entries.meaning: (chiefly US) Having the characteristics of carpetbaggers.
A traveling bag made from scraps of carpet and widely used in the United States (and elsewhere) in the 19th century.

verbs.description: carpetbag (third-person singular simple present carpetbags, present participle carpetbagging, simple past and past participle carpetbagged)

entries.meaning: (chiefly US) To come to a place or organisation with which one has no previous connection with the sole or primary aim of personal gain, especially political or financial gain.
